;英国警察监督机构前负责人被控强奸和其他性犯罪针对一名 16 岁以下的女孩。

;

;警察行为独立办公室 (IOPC) 前任总干事迈克尔·洛克伍德 (Michael Lockwood) 被控六项猥亵罪和三项强奸罪，皇家检察署表示。

;

;现年 64 岁的洛克伍德在 12 月辞去了他在 IOPC 的职务，因为他是警方调查一项历史指控的对象。

;

;据称这些罪行发生在 1985 年 10 月至 1986 年 3 月之间。

;

;他将于 6 月 28 日在威斯敏斯特地方法院出庭。

;

;伦敦警方在警官承认后遭到炮击至 24 项强奸罪名

;

;皇家检察署 (CPS) 特别犯罪部门负责人罗斯玛丽·安斯利 (Rosemary Ainslie) 表示：“在仔细考虑亨伯赛德警方提供给我们的所有证据后，我们已授权根据 1956 年《性犯罪法》，对 64 岁的迈克尔洛克伍德提出九项指控。

;

;“洛克伍德先生被指控犯有六项猥亵罪和三项强奸 16 岁以下女孩的罪名，据称是在 1980 年代犯下的。

;

;“皇家检察院提醒所有相关人员，针对 Lockwood 先生的刑事诉讼正在进行中，他有权获得公正审判。”

;

;洛克伍德是 IOPC 在 2018 年取代独立警察投诉委员会后被任命领导的第一位总干事。

;

;他之前是伦敦西北部哈罗区的首席执行官。

;< h3>;连环强奸犯伦敦警官被判终身监禁;

;在 2017 年格伦菲尔塔火灾后，政府工作组要求他领导恢复和补救工作，并与失去亲人的家人、幸存者和更广泛的人联络

;

;Lockwood 去年卸任后，IOPC 宣布正在进行审查，以确定在他辞职前“是否采取了适当的措施”。

;

;内政大臣苏埃拉·布雷弗曼 (Suella Braverman) 在在得知他是警方调查的对象后，她采取了“立即行动”，并指示她的官员要求他辞职或面临立即停职。

;

;IOPC 发言人周五表示： “我们知道 CPS 决定就与非近期事件有关的指控指控迈克尔·洛克伍德。

;

;“洛克伍德先生在 2018 年至 2022 年期间担任 IOPC 总干事，但作为官方任命人员，并未受雇由 IOPC。

;

;“由于刑事诉讼正在进行中，我们无法进一步发表评论。”

;中国启动了为期三年的痴呆症早期干预活动

;

;在本周给地方卫生部门的通知中，国家卫生委员会表示，该运动有三个目标：提高社会对痴呆症的认识，更好地识别患者，

;

;它说，“有足够资源”的地方政府应该每年对 65 岁以上的人进行认知障碍筛查。

;

;应该给予干预和指导向那些表现出认知能力下降早期迹象的人提供治疗，并为被诊断出患有这种疾病的人提供治疗。

;

;它还命令地方卫生当局为“记忆诊所”培训护理人员和工作人员，“记忆诊所”是政府最近设立的设施多年帮助失智症患者。该委员会表示，其他社会福利组织应为患者提供康复、护理和情感支持。

;

;

;

;该活动是 2019 年启动的“健康中国十年计划”的一部分，旨在减少人口慢性病和卫生系统负担。

;

;有超过根据去年 3 月发表在同行评议期刊《普通精神病学》上的《中国老年痴呆症报告》，中国 60 岁以上老年痴呆症患者有 1500 万人，其中 983 万人患有老年痴呆症。

;

;超过四分之一的人世界上总的来说，中国是世界上痴呆症患者数量最多的国家。

;

;中国的痴呆症患病率也高于世界平均水平。报告称，中国每 10 万人中有 788.3 人患有此病，而世界平均水平为每 10 万人中有 682.5 人。

;

;该报告由中国疾病预防控制中心专家组撰写，复旦大学和上海交通大学，没有说明发病率较高的原因。

;

;痴呆症是我国前五位死因之一，但社会对它了解甚少。< /p>;

;报告称，“该国阿尔茨海默氏症的诊断和治疗率仍然很低，医学专家很少，公众意识也很低。”

;

;预计护理需求只会增加，随着世界卫生组织预测，到 2040 年，中国 60 岁以上的人口将增加到总人口的 28%。在 2020 年的全国人口普查中，18.7% 的人口在人口中。

;

;痴呆症是指受损的记忆、思考和做出决定的能力。其原因包括与年龄相关的大脑变化，以及遗传、环境和生活方式因素。

;

;早期诊断和干预也会影响患病率。

;每个星期天黎明后，Sukla Debnath 都会打包一个装有美容产品的小袋子并拜访印度西孟加拉邦的茶园 o 在化妆、美发和美甲方面对年轻女性进行培训，其中大多数是原住民（称为阿迪瓦西人）。

;

;这是一个为期三个月的课程，由 35-岁的 Sukla 是采茶工下班的唯一一天，在这个地区，他们的部落身份使他们成为印度最贫穷的人之一。培训为她们提供了新的收入来源，尤其是在印度冬季的“婚礼季节”，那时种植园工作经常枯竭。

;

;20 多年来，Sukla 在她位于该邦 Alipurduar 的家附近培训了 5000 多名妇女

;

;但是，这个课程远不止是一个学习美容秘诀以赚取一点额外收入的机会——它可以使她们摆脱在山坡上搜寻受害者的性贩子的魔掌。

;

;“我希望这些女性在经济上独立并了解周围的环境，”Sukla 说。 “这样他们就不会落入陷阱。”

;

;著名的大吉岭所在地西孟加拉邦的茶园坐落在连绵起伏的山丘上，女工熟练地采摘芳香的叶子，然后将其干燥和加工

;

;但这些也是贩运者的常规猎场，这些贩运者引诱弱势年轻女性进入性行业或强迫婚姻，并承诺在印度各地提供高薪工作。

;

;种植园中数以千计的原住民妇女接受低工资；恶劣、暴露的条件；

;

;他们的日薪为 232卢比（2.83 美元），但在扣除政府管理的退休基金后，从早上 6 点开始的 8 小时轮班工作可获得约 200 卢比的报酬。

;

;他们的选择有限。统计数据揭示了原住民社区所经历的惊人差距和经济困难。尽管他们仅占印度总人口的 8%，但他们占该国最贫穷 10% 人口的四分之一。

;

;茶园的低工资意味着工人无法在经济上养家糊口。因此，当人贩子伪装成工作代理人以更高的工资和诱人的新生活的承诺引诱他们时，很难拒绝。

;

;21 岁的 Sushma Mangar 说她很幸运 –但只是。当 Radharani 茶园关闭时，她全家的收入都被剥夺了，他们住在西孟加拉邦的 Jalpaiguri 区。

;

;由于几名成员突然失业，这家人决定派 Sushma 和一名代理人一起工作答应在德里找一份高薪工作。但 Sushma 在离开前在她的村庄遇到了 Sukla，并决定去上她的课。

;

;“当我告诉她我打算搬到德里工作时，她严厉地建议我不要去。我不知道这些人是特工，”Sushma 说。

;

;“如果那天我没有遇到她，我真的不知道我现在会在哪里。”

;

;“看到我们村的年轻女性赚到足够的钱来养活自己，真是太鼓舞人心了，”她说。 “在茶园里，我们拿的是最低工资，工作条件也不好。这为我们开辟了新的途径。”

;

;

;反贩运专家说，那些选择最少的人处于最严重的危险之中。

;

;但专家表示，这些数字掩盖了一个更深层次、更有害的问题，该问题渗透到该国每个贫困和弱势群体的邦

;

;

;

;从小苏克拉就听说过女孩们离开村庄寻找更好前景的故事。

;

;但她震惊地发现了她们旅程背后的残酷真相——她们被贩运、被迫从事剥削劳动或遭受性工作的恐怖。

;

;“我看到女孩消失，而且人数不断上升。从很小的时候起，我就知道我想帮助他们，即使这意味着强烈反对或让我的生命处于危险之中，”Sukla 告诉《亚洲周刊》。

;

;然而，反人口贩运活动人士表示，康复获救的受害者需要更多的长期资源。

;

;印度的性工作者如何帮助预防艾滋病流行

;

;“仅仅让受害者与家人团聚并不意味着他们的创伤结束，”他说Pallabi Ghosh，印度反人口贩运组织 Impact and Dialogue Foundation 的创始人。

;

;该基金会致力于预防、拯救和康复受现代奴役和人口贩运影响的幸存者和处于危险中的个人。

;

; p

;Pallabi 说：“家庭必须参加去污名化工作坊，并了解如何创造一个支持性的环境来促进孩子的康复。”

;

;到目前为止，她的基金会已经拯救了她说，在官员和执法机构的帮助下，有 7,000 多名女孩和男孩免于被贩运。

;

;

;

;苏克拉在她自己动手营救时只有 15 岁

;

;她卖掉自行车凑了 1200 卢比，用于学习如何成为一名美容师的课程。

;

;然后她化妆了为新娘，并用她赚的钱购买了她可以在课堂上教别人的产品。她说，这是她已故父亲支持的一项使命。

;

;意识到让农村父母相信化妆的优点是一项艰巨的任务，Sukla 走访了家庭，让家庭了解化妆所采用的欺骗策略人贩子冒充工人在印度各邦寻找雇员。

;

;尼泊尔人在印度被贩卖为性奴

;

;“一开始，说服家人让女儿加入班级很有挑战性，”她说。 “但随着越来越多的女性实现经济独立，她们也表达了对学习的兴趣。如今，当工作机会来自外部时，代理人就会被解雇，并被警告永远不要涉足他们的村庄。”

;

;没有人能再困住这些妇女了，她说。 “她们变得有力量，无所畏惧。”

;

;在郁郁葱葱的茶园中，Sushma 和 Manita 等女性加入了 Sukla 学习化妆艺术。但 Sushma 还向附近地区的年轻妇女和儿童教授空手道和自卫术。

;

;“这已经成为一场运动。这些妇女已经意识到自己的权利，她们不会再受骗，”苏克拉说。 “如果我父亲今天还活着，他会为我感到骄傲。”

;A mentorship scheme designed to lift Hong Kong pupils in subdivided flats out of poverty might be extended in its second year to cover those in public housing, the city's No 2 official said on Saturday.

;

;Launched in October, the government's “Strive and Rise” programme has enrolled 2,779 underprivileged secondary students living in the notoriously tiny homes in a bid to boost their social mobility.

;

;Each young person has been assigned a mentor and would receive a total of HK$10,000 (US$1,278) throughout the programme which includes both mandatory courses as well as optional classes and tours.

;

;Chief Secretary Eric Chan Kwok-ki on Saturday suggested that as current participants in the programme were due to join an “alumni club” later this year, the administration was looking to expand eligibility for the next enrolment round.

;

;“The pupils don't have to be living in subdivided flats, perhaps also those in public housing? We will consider all these,” he told a radio programme.

;

;The scheme was well-funded after raising HK$140 million from the business and community sectors last year, Chan noted, and there was no concern about finding sufficient mentors to match a larger number of participants.

;

;Hong Kong's second combination hotel and youth hostel opens for applications

;

;Having invited two groups of pupils to his official residence, Chan said he had personally observed changes in the students as they gained exposure outside their confined social circles through the programme.

;

;“They've become active in asking questions, showing that they have gained confidence,” he said. “This is what the scheme is designed to do. Their self-confidence should not be constrained due to their family circumstances.”

;

;Chan said only about 20 students have dropped out of the programme before its start mainly because of schedule conflicts, adding that some businesses had pledged to offer internships to participants.

;

;There were 274,900 children living in poverty in Hong Kong in 2020, according to the latest available data. That meant a poverty rate of 27 per cent, the highest since records began in 2009.

;

;The scheme came amid Beijing's emphasis on the concept of common prosperity, under which social mobility should be enhanced to give more people opportunities to prosper and shape a development environment for everyone.

;

;2 firms recruited to help Hong Kong youth working in Greater Bay Area: labour chief

;

;To support families in need, Chan said in the new school year the government also planned to launch the After School Care Service Pilot Scheme in partnership with select primary schools and NGOs.

;

;He added schoolchildren of low-income families could join for free to allow parents more time at work, which could both encourage childbirth and free up labour.

;

;“The scheme has many benefits. Besides freeing up time for parents, we can also make use of those two or three hours every day to teach students something,” Chan said, suggesting topics such as career planning and financial management.

;

;About HK$90 million has been set aside for the scheme to benefit some 3,000 pupils in the one-year pilot. Chan suggested the goal was to expand the scheme across the city to benefit all families in need.

;

;With the current administration set to mark its first anniversary next month, Chan said his first year as the city's No 2 official had been filled with excitement because he had been able to focus on policymaking and delivering results, instead of dealing with the fallout of the anti-government protests in 2019.

;Billionaire technology entrepreneur Elon Musk expects his brain-chip start-up Neuralink to start its first human trial this year, he said on Friday in France.

;

;Speaking at the VivaTech event in Paris, Neuralink co-founder Musk said the company plans to implant a tetraplegic or paraplegic patient during a webcast monitored by Reuters.

;

;While he did not specify how many patients his company would implant or for how long, “it's looking like the first case will be later this year”, said Musk, who is also chief executive of electric carmaker Tesla and rocket launch company Space Exploration Technologies Corp. Earlier this month, Musk stepped down as head of social media platform Twitter.

;

;Last month, Neuralink said it received US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) clearance for its first-in-human clinical trial, a critical milestone for the start-up as it faces an investigation in the country over its handling of animal experiments.

;

;The FDA acknowledged in an earlier statement to Reuters that the agency cleared Neuralink to use its brain implant and surgical robot for trials, but declined to provide more details.

;

;If Neuralink can prove its device is safe in humans, it would still take several years – potentially more than a decade – for the start-up to secure commercial-use clearance, experts earlier told Reuters. The company is also competing with other neurotech companies which have already implanted their devices in people.

;

;Musk, however, has missed timelines on his public pronouncements about Neuralink before. On at least four occasions since 2019, Musk predicted that Neuralink would soon start human trials.

;

;Neuralink, founded in 2016, first sought permission from the FDA early last year, and the agency rejected the application, citing dozens of safety concerns, Reuters has reported. Some of the issues involved the lithium battery of the device, the possibility of the implant's wires migrating within the brain and the challenge of safely extracting the device without damaging brain tissue.

;

;Neuralink also faces federal scrutiny, following Reuters reports about its animal experiments.

;

;Last year, Neuralink employees told Reuters the company was rushing and botching surgeries on monkeys, pigs and sheep, resulting in more animal deaths than necessary, as Musk pressured staff to receive FDA approval. The animal experiments produced data intended to support the company's application for human trials, the sources said.

;

;In one instance in 2021, the company implanted 25 out of 60 pigs with the wrong-sized devices. All the pigs were subsequently killed – an error that employees said could have been easily avoided with more preparation.

;

;In May, US lawmakers urged regulators to investigate whether the make-up of Neuralink's panel overseeing animal testing contributed to botched and rushed experiments after Reuters reported on potential financial conflicts on the board.

;

;Elon Musk's Neuralink is exciting and terrifying to people in China

;

;The US Department of Transportation is separately investigating whether Neuralink illegally transported dangerous pathogens on chips removed from monkey brains without proper containment measures. An agency representative said on Friday the investigation is ongoing.

;

;Neuralink has also been under investigation by the US Department of Agriculture's (USDA) Office of Inspector General for potential animal-welfare violations. This inquiry has been looking at the USDA's oversight of Neuralink. An agency representative did not immediately respond to a comment request.

;

;Meanwhile, Neuralink's valuation has shot up in recent months. The start-up was valued at close to US$2 billion in a private fundraising round two years ago and is now worth around US$5 billion based on privately executed stock trades, Reuters reported this month.

;

;Neuralink employees who sat on the company's animal board, which has come under federal scrutiny for potential financial conflicts, stood to benefit from the implant's quick development. Neuralink stock that some of the employees hold has jumped around 150 per cent in value in just two years, based on the secondary trades, Reuters reported.
